Title: Portfolio Simulation Platform
Description: Enterprise-grade simulation platform for Asset Management Firms, Hedge Funds, and Proprietary Trading Desks. Enable training on execution strategies, risk management, and portfolio construction in a controlled, high-fidelity simulation environment.
Acceptance Criteria: - Platform supports multi-user simulation venues (Exchanges) - Risk Managers can configure market regimes - Portfolio Managers can execute trades and manage portfolios - Real-time market data simulation with configurable volatility - Comprehensive analytics and performance metrics

Title: Exchange Management
Description: Create and manage simulation venues (Exchanges) with multi-tenancy support. Each Exchange is an isolated simulation environment with role-based access control.
Acceptance Criteria: - Create new Exchanges with unique names - Assign Risk Manager role to creator - Support multiple concurrent Exchanges - Row-Level Security (RLS) enforcement

Title: Create Exchange API endpoint
Description: Implement POST /api/v1/exchanges endpoint to create new simulation venues. The creator is automatically assigned the RiskManager role.
Acceptance Criteria: - Validates request body with Zod schema - Creates Exchange record in database - Creates default ExchangeConfiguration - Assigns RiskManager role to creator - Returns Exchange details in response

Title: Implement Exchange RLS policies
Description: Configure Row-Level Security policies in SQL Database to ensure users can only access Exchanges where they have assigned roles.
Acceptance Criteria: - RLS policy blocks unauthorized access - SESSION_CONTEXT properly set for each request - Users see only their assigned Exchanges - SuperAdmin can see all Exchanges

Title: Exchange role management UI
Description: Build Angular component for managing Exchange roles. Risk Managers can assign PortfolioManager and Analyst roles to users.
Acceptance Criteria: - Display current role assignments - Add/remove user roles - Role dropdown with three options: RiskManager, PortfolioManager, Analyst - Permission checks enforce RiskManager-only access

Title: Exchange configuration page
Description: Create settings page for Exchange configuration including volatility, starting cash, commission rates, and margin settings.
Acceptance Criteria: - Form displays current configuration - Update configuration via API - Validation for numeric ranges - Changes take effect immediately

Title: Order Execution
Description: Support multiple order types (Market, Limit, Stop, Stop-Limit) with real-time order matching and execution.
Acceptance Criteria: - All order types supported - Orders matched against market prices - Portfolio positions updated on fill - Order status transitions tracked

Title: Create Order API endpoint
Description: Implement POST /api/v1/orders endpoint with Zod validation for all order types.
Acceptance Criteria: - Validates order type, side, quantity, price fields - Enforces required fields per order type - Creates order record in database - Returns order details with PENDING status

Title: Market order matching engine
Description: Implement matching logic for Market orders that execute immediately at current market price.
Acceptance Criteria: - Market orders execute within one tick cycle - Uses current bid/ask prices - Updates order status to FILLED - Creates transaction records

Title: Limit order matching engine
Description: Implement matching logic for Limit orders that execute only at specified price or better.
Acceptance Criteria: - Buy limit orders execute when market price <= limit price - Sell limit orders execute when market price >= limit price - Partial fills supported - Orders remain PENDING until filled or cancelled

Title: Stop and Stop-Limit order support
Description: Add support for Stop and Stop-Limit orders that trigger when market reaches stop price.
Acceptance Criteria: - Stop orders convert to Market orders when triggered - Stop-Limit orders convert to Limit orders when triggered - Trigger logic based on last traded price - Status transitions from PENDING to TRIGGERED to FILLED

Title: Market Simulation Engine
Description: Real-time market price simulation using random walk model with configurable volatility and tick intervals.
Acceptance Criteria: - Price updates generated every tick interval - Volatility configurable per Exchange - OHLC (Open-High-Low-Close) data aggregated - Price updates broadcast via SignalR

Title: Market tick timer function
Description: Create Azure Function with timer trigger that runs every 5 seconds to generate market updates.
Acceptance Criteria: - Timer trigger configured in function.json - Fetches all active Exchanges - Generates price updates for configured symbols - Processes pending orders

Title: Random walk price generation
Description: Implement random walk algorithm for realistic price movements based on Exchange volatility settings.
Acceptance Criteria: - Uses Gaussian distribution for price changes - Volatility parameter controls variance - Prices remain positive (no negative values) - Price changes validated with Zod schema

Title: OHLC data aggregation
Description: Aggregate tick-level price data into OHLC candles for charting and historical analysis.
Acceptance Criteria: - Supports multiple timeframes (1m, 5m, 15m, 1h, 1d) - Aggregation runs as Azure Function timer trigger - Data stored in Trade.OHLCData table - Efficient queries for chart data retrieval

Title: SignalR real-time price broadcast
Description: Broadcast price updates to connected clients using Azure SignalR Service with MessagePack protocol.
Acceptance Criteria: - Price updates sent via SignalR - MessagePack serialization for efficiency - Clients subscribed to Exchange-specific channels - Maximum 100ms latency

Title: Portfolio Management
Description: Create and manage portfolios within an Exchange. Track positions, cash balances, and P&L.
Acceptance Criteria: - Create portfolios with starting cash - View current positions and balances - Calculate unrealized P&L - Support multiple portfolios per user

Title: Create Portfolio API endpoint
Description: Implement POST /api/v1/portfolios endpoint to create new portfolios within an Exchange.
Acceptance Criteria: - Validates request with Zod schema - Creates Portfolio record - Initializes cash balance from Exchange config - Associates portfolio with user and Exchange

Title: Portfolio positions view
Description: Display current positions for a portfolio including symbol, quantity, average cost, and current value.
Acceptance Criteria: - GET /api/v1/portfolios/:id/positions endpoint - Returns array of positions - Calculates unrealized P&L per position - Updates in real-time via SignalR

Title: Portfolio P&L calculation
Description: Calculate total portfolio P&L including realized and unrealized gains/losses.
Acceptance Criteria: - Realized P&L from closed positions - Unrealized P&L from open positions - Total P&L = Realized + Unrealized - P&L displayed in portfolio summary

Title: Portfolio analytics dashboard
Description: Build dashboard showing portfolio performance metrics including Sharpe ratio, max drawdown, and volatility.
Acceptance Criteria: - Display key performance metrics - Charts showing equity curve over time - Daily returns histogram - Risk-adjusted return metrics

Title: Trading UI
Description: Institutional-grade trading interface with Kendo UI components. Display real-time market data
Acceptance Criteria: order entry

Title: Price chart with Kendo Charts
Description: Implement candlestick chart using Kendo ChartComponent to display OHLC price data.
Acceptance Criteria: - Uses @progress/kendo-angular-charts - Candlestick series for price - Volume bars below price chart - Multiple timeframes supported - Real-time updates via SignalR

Title: Order entry form component
Description: Build order entry form with dropdowns for order type, side, and input fields for quantity and price.
Acceptance Criteria: - Angular standalone component - Kendo UI form controls - Real-time validation - Submit calls createOrder API - Displays success/error messages

Title: Order blotter with Kendo Grid
Description: Display all orders in a Kendo Grid with sorting, filtering, and real-time updates.
Acceptance Criteria: - Uses Kendo GridComponent - Shows order status, type, symbol, quantity, price - Sortable columns - Filterable by status - Updates in real-time via SignalR

Title: Position blotter
Description: Display current positions in a grid showing symbol, quantity, average cost, current price, and P&L.
Acceptance Criteria: - Kendo Grid with position data - Color coding for P&L (green/red) - Real-time price updates - Calculated unrealized P&L

Title: Market depth display
Description: Show order book depth with bid/ask prices and quantities.
Acceptance Criteria: - Display top 10 bid/ask levels - Color coded (buy=green
column9: sell=red) - Real-time updates - Click to populate order entry form

Title: Analytics & Reporting
Description: Performance analytics, risk metrics, and historical reporting capabilities.
Acceptance Criteria: - Portfolio performance reports - Trade execution quality metrics - Risk exposure analysis - Historical data export

Title: Performance attribution report
Description: Generate performance attribution report breaking down returns by security and time period.
Acceptance Criteria: - Returns by security - Returns by time period (daily, weekly, monthly) - Contribution to total return - Export to CSV/Excel

Title: Trade execution quality metrics
Description: Calculate execution quality metrics including slippage, fill rate, and time to execution.
Acceptance Criteria: - Slippage calculation (execution price vs. market price) - Fill rate percentage - Average time to execution - Metrics by order type

Title: Risk exposure dashboard
Description: Display current risk exposure including concentration risk, sector exposure, and VaR.
Acceptance Criteria: - Position concentration by symbol - Sector/industry exposure breakdown - Value at Risk (VaR) calculation - Charts with Kendo ChartComponent

Title: Historical data export
Description: Export historical price data, orders, and transactions to CSV format.
Acceptance Criteria: - Export OHLC data to CSV - Export order history to CSV - Export transaction history to CSV - Date range selection
